title: Using chat to attempt to tilt the enemy team and be unsportsmanlike should be punishable
body: Saying things like "EZ" "YOU DIED LOL" "We WIN LOL" "+20 LP LOL" "GGEZ LOL" do not make you cool. They do not make you seem like a better player. They just make you an asshole. Please don't be that guy.

replies.body: Tilting the enemy is a viable strategy.
Those examples you show _are_ punishable, but tilt tactics, as far as I know, aren't. There is a little room for competitive BM, but - as mentioned - the examples you have there are just dickish.

Not that I agree with that at all, but how do you think an automated system could determine the context of it? Someone could easily say something like "we win lol" or "you died lol" without being "unsportsmanlike".

How could they say that without being unsportsmanlike? Even the tamest examples are still unsportsmanlike.

What about that is considered unsportsmanlike? Lets say someone died to a single minion after a close toplane fight. Would typing "you died lol" be unsportsmanlike? You have to remember that Riots system doesn't use any context.
Is playing pacifist singed in all chat rude?
If I'm a 0/9 Mid and I win, you bet your ass I'll say GG Easy

Nah, it's fun.

I resort to it when the person on the enemy team is raging or insulting how bad I must be even though they're 0/5 because of our lane. I know they're already pissed off at losing to someone they consider trash, and they opened the door first.
